wikipedia_page.main:
James Fowler (born 26 October 1980) is a Scottish professional football coach and former player, who is currently the head of football operations at Kilmarnock.
As a player, Fowler spent fourteen years of his career with Kilmarnock, making over 400 league appearances, and represented Scotland internationally at under-21 and B levels.
Towards the end of his playing career, Fowler signed with Queen of the South as a player/coach. He was soon afterwards appointed team manager, and held this position until April 2016. He then assisted Jack Ross at St Mirren and Sunderland, before returning to Kilmarnock in November 2019.

response: ; Most SPL appearances: James Fowler, 401 (correct to the end of the 2012–13 season)

* James Fowler - Captain 2012 League Cup Winners
In October 2016 he was inducted into the Kilmarnock 'Hall of Fame' alongside other well-known former players such as James Fowler, Ray Montgomerie and Stuart McLean (no relation).
